intro: Ficinia setiformis, commonly known as the slender spike sedge, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spike-like clusters. It typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Ficinia setiformis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
